page.title: 07Education
page.content: At one end of the building stands a two storey stone built building which is the local primary school. The size of the building indicates that it once housed many more pupils. It is known as Borgue Academy and was built about 1802. Secondary work continued at the school until 1947, after which all children over 12 travelled to Kirkcudbright Academy, 6 miles away. Now we have only two classes - P1-3 and P4-7, as our numbers have dwindled to about 33. This is probably because machinery has taken over man power on the farms, and over the years there has been a steady dwindling of people away from the country into the towns. However, a wide and varied curriculum is taught, and children leaving the school at 12 cope well with their secondary education.
